name: Central Park
description: A sprawling urban oasis in the heart of New York City, known for its lush greenery, scenic pathways, and iconic landmarks.

name: Eiffel Tower
description: A wrought-iron lattice tower located on the Champ de Mars in Paris, France. A symbol of romance and one of the most recognizable structures in the world.

name: Machu Picchu
description: An ancient Incan citadel set high in the Andes Mountains of Peru. Known for its breathtaking panoramic views and well-preserved archaeological wonders.

name: Tokyo Skytree
description: A modern broadcasting and observation tower in Sumida, Tokyo, Japan. Offers panoramic views of the cityscape and is a prominent landmark.

name: Great Barrier Reef
description: The world's largest coral reef system, located in the Coral Sea off the coast of Queensland, Australia. Famous for its stunning marine biodiversity.

name: Serengeti National Park
description: A vast wildlife reserve in Tanzania, known for its annual migration of wildebeest and other animals. Offers a unique safari experience.

name: Grand Canyon
description: A massive canyon carved by the Colorado River in Arizona, USA. Renowned for its stunning geological formations and vibrant colors.

name: The Louvre
description: The world's largest art museum and a historic monument in Paris, France. Home to thousands of works of art, including the Mona Lisa.

name: Sydney Opera House
description: An iconic performing arts venue in Sydney, Australia, known for its distinctive shell-like architecture. A UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Victoria Falls
description: A breathtaking waterfall on the Zambezi River, bordering Zambia and Zimbabwe. One of the largest and most famous waterfalls in the world.

name: Banff National Park
description: Canada's oldest national park, located in the Rocky Mountains of Alberta. Known for its stunning alpine landscapes, wildlife, and outdoor activities.

name: Petra
description: A historical and archaeological city in southern Jordan, famous for its rock-cut architecture and water conduit system. A UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Mount Everest
description: The world's highest mountain, part of the Himalayas on the Nepal-Tibet border. A challenging destination for climbers and a symbol of human determination.

name: Venice
description: A unique city in northeastern Italy, built on a network of canals. Known for its picturesque waterways, historic architecture, and vibrant culture.

name: Yellowstone National Park
description: The first and oldest national park in the world, located primarily in the U.S. states of Wyoming and Montana. Home to diverse ecosystems and geothermal features.

name: Great Wall of China
description: A series of fortifications made of stone, brick, tamped earth, wood, and other materials, generally built along an east-to-west line across the northern borders of China.

name: Aoraki / Mount Cook
description: The highest mountain in New Zealand, part of the Southern Alps. Surrounded by a national park and offering stunning alpine scenery.

name: Iguazu Falls
description: A system of waterfalls on the Iguazu River, located on the border between Argentina and Brazil. Renowned for its breathtaking natural beauty.

name: The Acropolis
description: An ancient citadel on a rocky outcrop above the city of Athens, Greece. Home to several ancient buildings of great architectural and historic significance.

name: Niagara Falls
description: A group of three waterfalls at the southern end of Niagara Gorge, between the Canadian province of Ontario and the U.S. state of New York. A popular tourist destination.
